Line 112: Line 112:
On 4/11/2006, Lincoln's Board of Trustees voted to revive the Football program, and establish Marching & Pep Bands. The University has petitioned membership in the [[Central Intercollegiate Athletic Association|CIAA]], of which Lincoln was a founding member of the league. Lincoln will be moving from the NCAA's Division III to Division II. A club football team is scheduled for the 2008 followed with a full Division II schedule in 2009.
On 4/11/2006, Lincoln's Board of Trustees voted to revive the Football program, and establish Marching & Pep Bands. The University has petitioned membership in the [[Central Intercollegiate Athletic Association|CIAA]], of which Lincoln was a founding member of the league. Lincoln will be moving from the NCAA's Division III to Division II. A club football team is scheduled for the 2008 followed with a full Division II schedule in 2009.
â
On Decmember 2, 2006, Lincoln's basketball team set 5 Division III records in a 201-78 victory over [[Ohio State University, Marion Campus|Ohio State Marion]]. They included points in a half and a game, as well as the NCAA record for margin of victory.
+
On Decmember 2, 2006, Lincoln's basketball team set 5 Division III records in a 201-78 victory over [[Ohio State University, Marion Campus|Ohio State Marion]]. They included points in a half and a game, as well as the NCAA record for margin of victory. The record-setting game has received significant publicity, both positive and negative. The coach and team have been criticized for "humiliat[ing] a helpless opponent",<ref name=easterbrook >{{cite web
  +
| url = http://sports.espn.go.com/espn/page2/story?page=easterbrook/061212
  +
| title = Tuesday Morning Quarterback - Ravens good, Manning bad
  +
| accessdate = 2006-12-12
  +
| last = Easterbrook
  +
| first = Gregg
  +
| authorlink = Gregg Easterbrook
  +
| date = [[2006-12-12]]
  +
| publisher = ESPN.com
  +
}}</ref> as Ohio State Marion is a non-NCAA school that only was able to suit six players. Lincoln played "full-court press in the second half" and one player "attempted 41 three-pointers, continuing to launch treys when the school was ahead by more than 100 points."<ref name=easterbrook /> Lincoln coach [[Garfield Yuille]] defended the actions of himself and his team, saying that "he could not tell his team to stop playing hard" and "late in the game... [he] told his team to walk the ball up the floor, even at the risk of a shot-clock violation."<ref name=nytimes>{{cite web
  +
| url = http://www.nytimes.com/2006/12/09/sports/ncaabasketball/09lincoln.html?_r=2&oref=slogin&oref=slogin
  +
| title = University on the Defensive for Scoring 201 Points
  +
| accessdate = 2006-12-12
  +
| last = Caldwell
  +
| first = Dave
  +
| date = [[2006-12-09]]
  +
| publisher = The New York Times
  +
}}</ref>
